TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataPagerFieldItem extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents a pager field item in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> class is created to hold the pager controls in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface is a marker that indicates that the container control represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> class is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object's control hierarchy.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> class is typically used in the handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object. It is used to access controls inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object and to access the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property represents the pager field item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField field, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager pager) cil managed

Docs.param: The pager control that contains the pager field object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the event for the server control is passed up the page's UI server control hierarchy.
Docs.returns: if the event was sent to the parent control; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the pager control that contains the pager field object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem.Pager%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. This property is typically used to access the properties of the control in an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand?displayProperty=fullName> event.
## Examples The following example shows how to access properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem.Pager%2A> property in a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand?displayProperty=fullName> event. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
